ea4cd2f0efef9310f548e4f684415402 (22:30): webputty seems like a really sketchy idea
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (22:36): c22dd2b62efa3a2007bf836ae2aca91c: No downsides that I know of.  It won't slow the browser down, it just renders text fields with a little extra control.
bdedc97e25dde1328bae6e2d092691c8 (22:40): 47afa57e9d0a03b554b6f357c064d743: I think WebPutty is a really good idea.  It's a spiffy editor + hosting + "FTP" application

fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55 (23:07): does html5 need a /> tag on things like <br>?
47afa57e9d0a03b554b6f357c064d743 (23:07): no becauz in html 5 u dont use things like 'br's :)
fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55 (23:08): ok, what about input or <img> or etc..
47afa57e9d0a03b554b6f357c064d743 (23:08): it depends
47afa57e9d0a03b554b6f357c064d743 (23:09): if you want to close it without to put some thing else in it make it with just />
fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55 (23:10): input and img last i checked could wrap anything...
fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55 (23:10): couldnt*
47afa57e9d0a03b554b6f357c064d743 (23:11): just make it , i dont know the specs exactly ... look and then ask again if you ...
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:12): fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55: It's a good idea to always close your tags, just for maximum compatibility.
fec421fa8bb9efbd7ef21e44bb1b9d55 (23:12): ok, thanks
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:13): "self-closing" tags will cause you to write <script src="foo" /> at least once in your life
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:13): And then you'll stop doing it
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:13): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: empty script tags are not allowed, even though they're common.
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:14): But that doesn't mean that you should abandon all compatibility with HTML.
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:19): Yeah, I'm a n00b. Empty script tags are allowed, but you can't self-close a non-void element.

7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:24): html allows for absent closing tags (there are some tags that need them though, like script). Xhtml every tag must be closes wither with a self close /> or with a closing tag
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:24): in html you can use simple attributes like <input type="checkbox" checked>
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:25): in xhtml you have to write it all: <input type="checkbox" checked="checked" />
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:25): You can write checked="" in XHTML
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:25): but in the end you should use the correct syntax to match your doctype
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:26): Doctypes are irrelevant
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:26): html5 is compatible with xhtml on purpose.
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:26): I wouldn't go as far as saying irrevelant
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (23:27): 87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957: I'm hoping this doctype outlives version 5 and that backwards compatibility
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (23:27): They have exactly one purpose, and that's to keep you out of quirks mode in text/html
87023425f8584ab838d4216538dad957 (23:27): well, the new doctype is supposed to be the one doctype to rule them all.
